title: Barack Obama
content: Barack Obama was born in Honolulu, Hawaii in 1961.
He served as the 44th President of the United States from 2009 to 2017.
Obama graduated from Harvard Law School in 1991.
He was a senator from Illinois before becoming president.
Obama received the Nobel Peace Prize in 2009.

title: Michelle Obama
content: Michelle Obama was born on January 17, 1964 in Chicago, Illinois.
She is an American lawyer and writer.
Michelle Obama was the First Lady of the United States from 2009 to 2017.
She married Barack Obama in 1992.
Michelle graduated from Princeton University and Harvard Law School.

title: Harvard Law School
content: Harvard Law School is one of the professional graduate schools of Harvard University.
It was founded in 1817 and is the oldest continuously operating law school in the United States.
The school is located in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
Many notable lawyers and politicians graduated from Harvard Law School.
Barack Obama and Michelle Obama both graduated from Harvard Law School.

title: Nobel Peace Prize
content: The Nobel Peace Prize is awarded annually in Oslo, Norway.
It was established by the will of Alfred Nobel in 1895.
The prize is given to those who have done the most or best work for fraternity between nations.
Barack Obama received the Nobel Peace Prize in 2009.
Other notable recipients include Martin Luther King Jr. and Nelson Mandela.
